page.title: 08GOONHILLY NATURE RESERVE
page.content: The dominant plant species over the habitat is the beautiful Cornish Heath {(Erica vagans),}a species so abundant here yet present in only one other very restricted Cornish site and not known elsewhere in Britain.(In Northern Ireland its native status is in some doubt). Four other species of Heath occur: Heather (Ling),Bell Heather, Cross-leaved Heath and Dorset Heath, another rare species,scarce at the Lizard and in West Cornwall but locally common in South Devon and Dorset. the Cornish heath is found in several colour varieties in the wild and still moe in cultivation.(It is interesting to note that there have been cases of hybrids between the Cornish heath and the Cross-leaved Heath).
